title: Doncaster
summary: Doncaster (/ˈdɒŋkəstər/, /-kæs-/[2][3]) is a large minster town and the principal settlement of the Metropolitan Borough of Doncaster in South Yorkshire, England. The town is named after the River Don which flows through it. It was part of the West Riding of Yorkshire from 1899. Under the Local Government Act 1972, it was incorporated into a newly created metropolitan borough in 1974 as part of the South Yorkshire metropolitan county.
